meta.title: Coronavirus Update - Coronavirus - Tri-City United Schools

img.alt: Tri-City United Public Schools 101 2nd St. NE, Montgomery, MN 56069 (507) 364-8100

span.style: font-family :sans-serif, Arial, Verdana, \'Trebuchet MS\'; font-size :9pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; text-decoration: none;background-color: ; color: black;

em.span: Tri-City United Schoolsunderstandthere are many questions regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19).We are monitoring the situation closely and watching for any update in guidance from the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH), local health agencies or the Centers for Disease Control (CDC).

span.strong: Under the guidance of the MDH, we are recommending the following simple, everyday habits to help prevent the spread of illness throughout our school communities:

li.span: As always, staff and students should stay home if they are feeling ill, have a fever of 100 degrees or more, or are exhibiting flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, shortness of breath.
Wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Use your own water bottle - do not share.
Cover a cough. Cough or sneeze into an elbow or use a tissue and place immediately in the trash.
If you have not already signed up, use this survey link to indicate your need for school meals while schools are closed: https://forms.gle/QeePAowU6fYjbJe2A
If you have already completed the survey, you do not need to resubmit.
Survey must be completed by 10:00 am in order to receive meals the following day

span.span: Updated Free Meal Pack Distribution information

As per the Executive Order, we have been providing childcare for healthcare/emergency personnel, TCU staff when needing to report, and continued for those who were already registered in TCU Kidzone/WRAP.The state has expanded the list of Tier I emergency workers Care for Children of Families Working in Critical Sectors. If your role now fits within the Tier I status, and you have not completed the parent survey indicating a need for childcare, please do so as soon as possible for our planning. If you did complete the survey but now qualify, please email Layne Wilbright, Community Education Director at var first='ma';var second='il';var third='to:';var address='lwilbright';var domain='tcu2905';var ext='us';document.write('');document.write(address);document.write('@');document.write(domain); document.write('.');document.write(ext);document.write('');.
